links.body: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Quotes Brain Blitz

value.text: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Quotes Brain Blitz
value.value_text: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Quotes Brain Blitz

paragraphs.body: Nicktoons Avatar State Brain Blitz, known informally as Avatar State Brain Blitz, is a game hosted on Nick.com.
paragraphs.text: Nicktoons Avatar State Brain Blitz, known informally as Avatar State Brain Blitz, is a game hosted on Nick.com.

paragraphs.body: Unlike most Avatar games, Avatar State Brain Blitz gives the player the opportunity to play not as a character of the television series, but as a sort of contestant in a quiz game. The player must attempt to accumulate as many points as possible during the challenge by answering questions correctly and in the most timely manner possible.
paragraphs.text: Unlike most Avatar games, Avatar State Brain Blitz gives the player the opportunity to play not as a character of the television series, but as a sort of contestant in a quiz game. The player must attempt to accumulate as many points as possible during the challenge by answering questions correctly and in the most timely manner possible.

paragraphs.body: All actions are performed through the left mouse click.
paragraphs.text: All actions are performed through the left mouse click.

paragraphs.body: There are four quizzes to choose from, each of which is preceded by a week number: Path of Water (Week One), Path of Earth (Week Two), Path of Fire (Week Three), and Path of the Avatar (Week Four). In order to score high marks in either quiz, one must answer each of the nine questions without letting the timer reach zero, which incurs a zero point gain, as does choosing the incorrect answer. The mechanics for choosing the correct answer are different; if the player is right in his or her choice, he or she will earn ten to a hundred points depending on the swiftness with which he or she answered. If the player answers before one second can pass (thereby leaving a "10" on the timer signifying the time the player had left to answer), he or she will earn one hundred points. If there are nine seconds left on the clock, ninety points are awarded, one second on the clock, ten points awarded, etc. Points accumulate after multiple quiz play-throughs, e.g. one may complete one's first quiz with 950 points and complete one's second quiz with 150 points, and the "Brain Blitz Total" will read 1100. If a score becomes high enough, it may be featured on the leaderboard.
paragraphs.text: There are four quizzes to choose from, each of which is preceded by a week number: Path of Water (Week One), Path of Earth (Week Two), Path of Fire (Week Three), and Path of the Avatar (Week Four). In order to score high marks in either quiz, one must answer each of the nine questions without letting the timer reach zero, which incurs a zero point gain, as does choosing the incorrect answer. The mechanics for choosing the correct answer are different; if the player is right in his or her choice, he or she will earn ten to a hundred points depending on the swiftness with which he or she answered. If the player answers before one second can pass (thereby leaving a "10" on the timer signifying the time the player had left to answer), he or she will earn one hundred points. If there are nine seconds left on the clock, ninety points are awarded, one second on the clock, ten points awarded, etc. Points accumulate after multiple quiz play-throughs, e.g. one may complete one's first quiz with 950 points and complete one's second quiz with 150 points, and the "Brain Blitz Total" will read 1100. If a score becomes high enough, it may be featured on the leaderboard.

paragraphs.body: There are a few different types of question, each of which offers a unique type of challenge for the player. These quiz types include:
paragraphs.text: There are a few different types of question, each of which offers a unique type of challenge for the player. These quiz types include:

paragraphs.body: Pop quiz – Four choices of answer are provided, and the player must choose one of these as his or her choice of correct answer in a quiz concerning info from the plot of the series.
paragraphs.text: Pop quiz – Four choices of answer are provided, and the player must choose one of these as his or her choice of correct answer in a quiz concerning info from the plot of the series.

paragraphs.body: Guess who? – An image that begins shrouded in a blur slowly makes itself less incomprehensible as the timer ticks down. The challenge is to decipher the image and choose the correct answer before times runs out.
paragraphs.text: Guess who? – An image that begins shrouded in a blur slowly makes itself less incomprehensible as the timer ticks down. The challenge is to decipher the image and choose the correct answer before times runs out.

paragraphs.body: What's next – A portion of an episode is played on a small screen. When the episode portions pauses, the player chooses from three optional answers to decide what happens immediately after the pause.
paragraphs.text: What's next – A portion of an episode is played on a small screen. When the episode portions pauses, the player chooses from three optional answers to decide what happens immediately after the pause.

paragraphs.body: Listen up – A moment of dialogue snipped from an episode is played without visuals. The player must choose from the choices who said this line, judging by recognition of the voice acting and of the line itself.
paragraphs.text: Listen up – A moment of dialogue snipped from an episode is played without visuals. The player must choose from the choices who said this line, judging by recognition of the voice acting and of the line itself.

paragraphs.body: There are four quizzes, each with identical questions, answers, question order, and point mechanics no matter how many times it is played. For example, the Path of Water quiz will always have nine questions, and each of these questions will be the same one in the same order every time it played. Even if one does not know the correct answers on the first try, one may simply play the same quiz again having memorized the questions and answers; knowing at least one answer that is incorrect, one would only have three choices of answer instead of four. The quizzes with their questions and correct answers are:
paragraphs.text: There are four quizzes, each with identical questions, answers, question order, and point mechanics no matter how many times it is played. For example, the Path of Water quiz will always have nine questions, and each of these questions will be the same one in the same order every time it played. Even if one does not know the correct answers on the first try, one may simply play the same quiz again having memorized the questions and answers; knowing at least one answer that is incorrect, one would only have three choices of answer instead of four. The quizzes with their questions and correct answers are:

paragraphs.body: The scene is the one from "${link_0}" in which the members of Team Avatar bicker over whether or not to open the mysterious box kept away in the attic of ${link_1}. In the end, they find themselves crowded around the now-unlocked box, but ${link_2} enters before they can look at its contents. She offers to show them what is inside and slowly raises her hand from the bottom of the container, holding a single item.
paragraphs.text: The scene is the one from "The Puppetmaster" in which the members of Team Avatar bicker over whether or not to open the mysterious box kept away in the attic of Hama's inn. In the end, they find themselves crowded around the now-unlocked box, but Hama enters before they can look at its contents. She offers to show them what is inside and slowly raises her hand from the bottom of the container, holding a single item.

paragraphs.body:
The game was originally updated on a weekly basis as evidenced by the distinctions of the quiz choices ("Week One", "Week Two", etc). However, since all four weeks of quiz revelations are long passed, the Quiz of the Week is always the fourth quiz, "Path of the Avatar".
 The fourth quiz is called by two names: "Path of Avatar" and "Path of the Avatar".
paragraphs.text:
The game was originally updated on a weekly basis as evidenced by the distinctions of the quiz choices ("Week One", "Week Two", etc). However, since all four weeks of quiz revelations are long passed, the Quiz of the Week is always the fourth quiz, "Path of the Avatar".
 The fourth quiz is called by two names: "Path of Avatar" and "Path of the Avatar".

paragraphs.body: The fourth quiz is called by two names: "Path of Avatar" and "Path of the Avatar".
paragraphs.text: The fourth quiz is called by two names: "Path of Avatar" and "Path of the Avatar".

paragraphs.body: Unlike most Avatar games, the leaderboard that displays the scores for past players can still be viewed with the scores intact. However, this scoreboard has been manipulated or glitched, as some of the supposedly top scores display as scores of zero and one point.
